name: B CMS
short_description:
Well, I've finally done it. After another terrible WordPress experience, I've decided to share my own CMS I use for small projects.

Why is it better? It's simple -- you don't need to learn my own special scripting language, shorthand, made up architecture paradigm, quirky notation, or convoluted plug-in system. No more wrangling and kludging just to get a simple task like customizing menus done.

The code base is a straight-up Object Oriented business layer with an MVC front-end. Simple, easy to understand objects that make sense, and a clean separation between business and display logic should make it straightforward to customize.

The goal of this project isn't to provide a product that's all things to all people, but rather to provide a platform that lets you quickly get a project up and running when the requirement is "CMS with one-or-two other things". How to extend it should be a matter left up to you, the developer. 

Release v.1a should be sometime in October.
